titleStmt.title: Bloudy nevves from Portsmouth : Being a true relation of a great and desperate onset given by Major Randol, on Friday morning last: with the particula[r]s thereof, the manner of the engagement, and the number killed and taken prisoners. Also, the re-inforcing and securing of Ports Down Fort by the Parliaments forces. And a declaration of Sir Arthur Hasilrig and Vice-Admiral Lawson: with proposals to the people, Army Navy, and the militia of London, and the countrey. Likewise, a message from General Monck, to the Lords, Knights, gentlemen, and sheriffs, in the northern parts; and their answer thereunto.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
